data.title: Martijn de Man
data.meta_description: Martijn de Man: Music composer and sound designer in Den Haag, Netherlands. Stage 32 creative profile. Learn more about Martijn de Man * news in the film industry * professional networking events
data.text:
Hoe Hannie ben jij? (2021)

Documentary by Deborah van Dam Composer/sound designer 'Hoe Hannie ben jij? ' is a docu-film about Hannie Schaft, better known as 'the Girl with the Red Hair', who was one of the few women to be part of the armed resistance against the German occupier during the Second World War.

Virgins (2020)

Music by Camiel Zwart (Drama) Composer A dance film about the life cycle of three Italian street prostitutes caught in a daily routine with no way out.

The Next Thing (2020)

Documentary (Documentary) Composer Hank, a senior American Dutch actor keeps going from gig to gig until his body stops.

Born to Be She (2020)

Short (Short) Composer A man walking into a bar confronts himself with his inner sense.

We zien ons (2019)

TV Series by Deborah van Dam (Documentary) Composer During a year we follow a number of residents of Lentjheuvel. In six episodes we become part of their lives and struggles.

Immersive Experience Winscape (2018)

Video Game by MCW Creative Agency Composer/Sound designer The immersive experience in Winscape is based on a science fiction story: The French space authorities are looking for candidates who will participate in a secret space mission in a few years. In a space training facility with 4 different courses, visitors are challenged to use senses, memory, logic and physicality for the best possible result.

Tormented (2018)

Film (short) by Marlon van der Strigt (Drama) Composer/Sound designer A one minute short film about a woman reliving memories while dealing with a recent trauma.

Eline (2017)

Film (short) by Carla Goedkoop Composer 'Eline' is a historical figure who prefers classic dancing in her luxurious life.

Algeria Land of Light (2017)

Documentary by Sander Ligthart Composer/Sound designer MCW & creative agency with colaboration of Skycam Algeria and Lahrech Film Production presented on the event of the ''World Expo'' in Astana '' Algeria Land of light''

Munch : Van Gogh (2015)

Documentary by Deborah van Dam Composer Munch : Van Gogh focuses on the parallels between two iconic artists. Their visions of life and art are closely related, even though they never met.

Untied (2014)

Film (short) by Ivan Cortazar Composer Springtime in New York City. Hot but not humid. The birds are singing. The blossoms are in full bloom. George strolls along the river with his radiant girlfriend Rebecca, but as he bends down to lace up his shoe, Rebecca says the most dreaded four words in the American lexicon: WE. NEED. TO. TALK.

Exitus (2013)

Film (short) by József Gallai Composer Two masked entities search the way-out from our world.

Me Aburro (2012)

Film (short) by Ivan Cortazar (Comedy) Composer We must admit that in your life, sometime, the end justifies the means.

Love (2012)

Film (short) by Sjoerd de Bont Composer made for the 48 Hour Film Project Belgium

Desastres (2011)

Film (short) by Ivan Cortazar Composer Iván has a history in losing keys, wallets, cellphones and any thing that ends up in his hands. This “special ability” Ivan has, as well as his baldness, is a genetic inheritance from his father Floren.

Bloodwood (2010)

Film by Joshua A.Siegel Composer A documentary film crew is stalked by a pack of cannibals.

Wilson & Wilson (2010)

Film (short) by Willeke Beekmans Composer/Sound Designer Graduation film from Willeke Beekmans

0,5 KM Noord (2009)

Documentary by Camiel Zwart Composer After 50 years of loyal service and many memories of happy and less happy moments of people who have lived there, 7 flats are discarded and replaced by something new. The buildings are given a voice through texts that appear on the walls. The residents are a living part of the flat, the blood in his veins. After the flat has slowly bled out, they will take the memories created in the flat to a new place.

Kicken (2007)

Short by Feije Riemersma Composer 12- year old Lisa loves to play football, but she's bullied for being the only girl on the field, and a rather poor player as well. One day, Lisa decides it is time to take fate in her own hands.

Going Straight (2005)

Film (short) by Kelly Abbott Vince Fesalbon Composer A gay man has to prove he is straight to get his inheritance. This isn't easy when he has to get married.

Nathan's Rebellion (2004)

Video by Kathy Fitzgerald Composer Lonely Nathan Daniels, almost 13, follows his teacher's advice and takes 'the road not taken'. He ends up on a farm in 1786 where he befriends a lonely farmer. Akin, they help each other out in life.

Messiah (2004)

Video by Kathy Fitzgerald Composer Aunt Kathryn, just losing her own son to violence, decides to write a story for her Easter dinner guests. She reads the story to her selfish nieces and nephews, putting them into the characters of the gospels to, maybe, change their ways for the better.
